dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: ...and, like, Kazakhstan, you know, they're caught up in this new round of, uh, Trump's trade duties.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...and, like, Kazakhstan, you know, they're caught up in this new round of, uh, Trump's trade duties.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Ministry of Trade and Integration commented on the decision of US President Donald Trump to impose duties on imports from 185 countries, including Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, great. More tariffs. Just what the world needed, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, great. More tariffs. Just what the world needed, huh?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But this is, um, actually kind of interesting. The Ministry of Trade there? They've done a preliminary analysis.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But this is, um, actually kind of interesting. The Ministry of Trade there? They've done a preliminary analysis.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "A preliminary analysis of the new trade measures taken by the American side showed that a significant part of Kazakhstan's exports to the United States are not subject to additional tariffs, since they are included in the list of exceptions provided for by the regulations of the US administration," the Ministry of Trade said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: 'Analysis.' So, they're telling us it's fine, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: 'Analysis.' So, they're telling us it's fine, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, yeah, mostly. They say a significant part of their exports to the US, like, the big stuff, it's not subject to these new tariffs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, yeah, mostly. They say a significant part of their exports to the U S, like, the big stuff, it's not subject to these new tariffs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: "...a significant part of Kazakhstan's exports to the United States are not subject to additional tariffs, since they are included in the list of exceptions provided for by the regulations of the US administration," the Ministry of Trade said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, what, oil and uranium? The things that actually matter?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what, oil and uranium? The things that actually matter?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The bulk of Kazakhstan's exports to the United States are crude oil, uranium, silver, ferroalloys, and others.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Crude oil, uranium, silver, ferroalloys. That's 92% of their deliveries, and they're on the exception list.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Crude oil, uranium, silver, ferroalloys. That's ninety two percent of their deliveries, and they're on the exception list.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The bulk of Kazakhstan's exports to the United States are crude oil, uranium, silver, ferroalloys, and others. These categories, which account for 92% of deliveries, are included in the list of exceptions provided for by the US President's decree...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. So what is getting hit then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. So what is getting hit then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Just 4.8% of their total exports. Um, things like phosphorus, ferrosilicon, lenses, wheat gluten.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Just four point eight percent of their total exports. Um, things like phosphorus, ferrosilicon, lenses, wheat gluten.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The introduced tariff measures will affect only 4.8% of the total volume of Kazakhstan's exports to the United States. These include phosphorus (in 2024, exports amounted to 15.9 million dollars), ferrosilicon ($12.7 million), lenses ($4.1 million), wheat gluten ($4 million), ammonium nitrate ($2.4 million).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And how much is that, really? Like, pocket change?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And how much is that, really? Like, pocket change?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's about $95 million. Not, um, insignificant, but definitely a small portion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's about ninety five dollars million. Not, um, insignificant, but definitely a small portion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Additional duties will apply to certain groups of goods, the export of which in 2024 amounted to 95.2 million dollars.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Compared to, what, the $4.2 billion trade turnover they had with the US last year?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Compared to, what, the four point two dollars billion trade turnover they had with the U S last year?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the Bureau of National Statistics, by the end of 2024, the trade turnover between Kazakhstan and the United States amounted to $4.2 billion...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah! Which was up 4% from the year before. And their exports to the US specifically jumped over 30%.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah! Which was up four percent from the year before. And their exports to the U S specifically jumped over thirty percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the trade turnover between Kazakhstan and the United States amounted to $4.2 billion, which is 4% higher than the previous year ($4.1 billion). Exports from Kazakhstan to the United States in 2024 increased by 30.6% and amounted to $2 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, essentially, they're doing just fine. Why even mention it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, essentially, they're doing just fine. Why even mention it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Because they're still facing a 27% tariff on that 4.8%.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Because they're still facing a twenty seven percent tariff on that four point eight percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The duties will affect a number of former Soviet Union countries: for Moldova, they will be 31%, for Kazakhstan, 27%...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the government's, uh, initiating consultations with the US.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the government's, uh, initiating consultations with the U S.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The government is initiating consultations with the American side to discuss the possibility of not applying additional duties to Kazakhstan," the ministry noted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: To beg them to, like, not apply it? Good luck.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: To beg them to, like, not apply it? Good luck.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They're a WTO member, Host_A. They're emphasizing their adherence to, um, fair trade.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're a W T O member, Host_A. They're emphasizing their adherence to, um, fair trade.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is noted that Kazakhstan has been a member of the World Trade Organization (WTO) for about 10 years and strictly adheres to its principles in the implementation of foreign trade policy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. Because that's always worked with, uh, that administration.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. Because that's always worked with, uh, that administration.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Still, it's, um, a critical detail for understanding the actual impact.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, it's, um, a critical detail for understanding the actual impact.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: If you say so.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: If you say so.
